channel.title: Looks like we can expect Half Life 3 rather than Episode 3
channel.description:
[url]https://www.develop-online.net/news/37625/Newell-Weve-moved-beyond-the-episodic-model[/url]
He doesn't say it clearly, but he does say, that they aren't going to continue the episodic model. So we can expect, that Episode 3 won't be released and that Valve will develop a Half Life 3. Well, I hope so.

item.title: Looks like we can expect Half Life 3 rather than Episode 3
item.dc:creator: mental2k
item.description:
They could always do a prologue at the start of HL3 tying up the the end of the episodic story arc, then have the main game arc be whatever the deal with the Borealis was (say you get teleported somewhere completely different by some Aperture tech on the Borealis). Then a final epilogue to tie up the overarching story.

item.title: Looks like we can expect Half Life 3 rather than Episode 3
item.dc:creator: slukaj
item.description:
danielsangeo:

Half-Life 1 did not feature the Combine at all. It was all Black Mesa and Xen. Half-Life 2 was all Combine. Half-Life 3 should not have Combine except as a reference (such as the references to the BMRF); it should have an entirely new kind of enemy. We haven’t finished with the Combine yet; we need to address that before going to Half-Life 3.

To me, thats a hard sell.

Sure, whoop-de-fucking-do, you found the Boreallis.

But the Combine have mother-fucking starships.

They’ll be back.

Now, transhumans? Ok, you might have something there. I’d like to see more Synths.
